Description: Limestone pillar altar, cylindrical column supporting a rectangular section inscribed with fifteen lines of Greek text, now much worn, recording a dedication by a citizen of Askalon to Serapis at Canopus. Dated to the 6th year of Severus Alexander (227AD), 17th Pharmuthi (12th April).
Bibliographic references: Inscription / The Collection of Ancient Greek Inscriptions in the British Museum (1072)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr Edward Nathaniel Bancroft
